Reasoning: The PDM relates to copyright status of a work, not typically to interactions with services that might involve tracking. Whether a user accepts tracking is independent of the public domain status of the content being accessed.
A work in the public domain can be aggregated with other works without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be annotated (e.g., adding notes or commentary) without copyright restriction.

If the work contains personal data, and one has the right to process it, anonymizing it is a form of modification/use, permissible for a public domain work. The PDM itself doesn't govern data protection, but doesn't restrict this act on the content.
A work in the public domain can be archived without copyright restriction.

While PDM itself doesn't mandate attribution (unlike some CC licenses), the act of attributing is not restricted. Moral rights may still apply in some jurisdictions, making attribution appropriate or required by other laws, but from a copyright permission standpoint under PDM, one *can* attribute.

PDM signifies public domain, which means no copyright conditions like mandatory attribution are imposed by the mark itself. While good practice, it's not a permission granted *by* PDM as a condition, but an inherent freedom.
Works in the public domain can be used for commercial purposes without copyright restriction.

The PDM indicates a work is free of copyright restriction there is no requirement or mechanism for compensation related to the copyright status. This action is usually a duty, not a permission granted to the user.
There are no copyright restrictions on how many people can use a public domain work simultaneously.
A user who has a copy of a public domain work can delete their copy. This refers to the user's copy, not the original or other copies.
Works in the public domain can be modified to create derivative works without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be used to derive new works without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain (if in analog form) can be digitized without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be displayed publicly without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be distributed without copyright restriction.
Synonymous with 'distribute'. Works in the public domain can be distributed.
The nature of public domain is non-exclusive. One cannot ensure exclusivity for a public domain work based on copyright.
If the public domain work is software or a program, it can be executed without copyright restriction.
Parts of a public domain work can be extracted without copyright restriction.
A copy of a public domain work can be given to others without copyright restriction.
An individual user cannot 'grant use' for a public domain work as if they are the rightsholder, because there are no copyright restrictions to grant. The work is already free for all to use.
A public domain work can be included in other collections or works without copyright restriction.
A public domain work can be indexed (e.g., by a search engine or for a database) without copyright restriction.
One can inform others about a public domain work or its contents. This is a general action not typically restricted by copyright.
If the public domain work is software, it can be installed without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be modified without copyright restriction.
A user can move their copy of a public domain work (e.g., from one storage device to another).
PDM signifies the end of copyright restrictions there is no 'next policy' in terms of copyright from the PDM itself.
PDM signifies public domain, which means no copyright conditions like requiring notices are imposed by the mark itself for the use of the work.
Consent is not needed for using a public domain work from a copyright perspective. This action is usually for data privacy contexts.
If the public domain work is a media file (audio/video), it can be played without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be presented (e.g., in a lecture or performance) without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be printed without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be read without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be reproduced (copied) without copyright restriction.
Synonymous with 'reproduce'. Works in the public domain can be reproduced.
The PDM is not a policy to be reviewed by the user in terms of their use rights it's a statement about the work's status.
A public domain work, or copies of it, can be sold. The copyright status does not prevent selling the work or a product incorporating it.
PDM signifies public domain. There is no ShareAlike condition, as that is a specific license term for copyrighted works.
Works in the public domain can be shared without copyright restriction.

If the PDM work is software and source code is available, it can be accessed and used. The PDM itself doesn't mandate providing source code, but using available source code of a PD program is permitted.
If the public domain work is media, it can be streamed without copyright restriction.
If the work is media (e.g., audio with video), it can be synchronized. This is a form of use/modification.
A textual public domain work can be converted to speech without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be transformed (a type of modification) without copyright restriction.
A work in the public domain can be translated without copyright restriction.
If the public domain work is installed software, it can be uninstalled.
A work in the public domain can be used for any purpose without copyright restriction.

While one *could* add a watermark to their copy of a public domain work, this action usually implies a restriction or a claim being asserted, which is contrary to the nature of public domain. PDM doesn't grant a 'permission' to watermark in a rights sense, but doesn't prevent one from modifying their copy. However, misleadingly implying copyright by a watermark would be problematic.
PDM does not prohibit accepting tracking. This is user choice, unrelated to copyright status.
PDM does not prohibit aggregation. Works are free to be aggregated.
PDM does not prohibit annotation. Works are free to be annotated.
PDM does not prohibit anonymization of data within a work, if applicable.
PDM does not prohibit archiving.
PDM does not prohibit attribution.
PDM does not require or prohibit attribution from a copyright perspective.
PDM does not prohibit commercial use.
PDM does not create a prohibition related to compensation.
PDM does not prohibit concurrent use.
PDM does not prohibit deleting one's copy of a work.
PDM does not prohibit creating derivative works.
PDM does not prohibit deriving new works.
PDM does not prohibit digitizing.
PDM does not prohibit display.
PDM does not prohibit distribution.
PDM does not prohibit distribution.

While PDM itself doesn't prohibit this action, the nature of public domain means one *cannot* ensure exclusivity based on copyright. So, attempting to assert copyright exclusivity over a PD work is effectively prohibited by the work's actual status. The action of ensuring exclusivity is counter to what PDM represents.
PDM does not prohibit execution (of software).
PDM does not prohibit extraction.
PDM does not prohibit giving a copy of the work.
PDM does not prohibit 'granting use', though such an act by a user would be meaningless for a PD work.
PDM does not prohibit including the work elsewhere.
PDM does not prohibit indexing.
PDM does not prohibit informing others about the work.
PDM does not prohibit installation (of software).
PDM does not prohibit modification.
PDM does not prohibit moving one's copy.
PDM does not prohibit the existence of other, unrelated policies.
PDM does not prohibit providing notices, though it does not require them for copyright purposes.
PDM does not prohibit obtaining consent if one chose to for other reasons, but it's not required for copyright.
PDM does not prohibit playing media.
PDM does not prohibit presenting the work.
PDM does not prohibit printing.
PDM does not prohibit reading.
PDM does not prohibit reproduction.
PDM does not prohibit reproduction.
PDM does not prohibit reviewing policies in general.
PDM does not prohibit selling.
PDM does not prohibit applying a ShareAlike license to one's *new contributions* if creating a derivative work, but it cannot be imposed on the original public domain work.
PDM does not prohibit sharing.
PDM does not prohibit accessing or using available source code of a PD program.
PDM does not prohibit streaming.
PDM does not prohibit synchronization.
PDM does not prohibit text-to-speech conversion.
PDM does not prohibit transformation.
PDM does not prohibit translation.
PDM does not prohibit uninstallation (of software).
PDM does not prohibit use.

PDM does not prohibit a user from adding a watermark to their own copy. However, adding a watermark that falsely implies copyright over the public domain work itself would be misleading and problematic, though not a prohibition from PDM directly.
PDM imposes no obligation to accept tracking.
PDM imposes no obligation to aggregate the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to annotate the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to anonymize data within the work (though other laws might).
PDM imposes no obligation to archive the work.

PDM itself imposes no obligation to attribute the author or work for copyright purposes, as it signifies public domain. Moral rights in some jurisdictions might create an obligation, but this is separate from PDM.
PDM signifies public domain, so there's no obligation for attribution under copyright.
PDM imposes no obligation for commercial use.
PDM imposes no obligation to compensate any party for use of the work under copyright.
PDM imposes no obligation regarding concurrent use.
PDM imposes no obligation to delete the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to create derivative works.
PDM imposes no obligation to derive new works.
PDM imposes no obligation to digitize the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to display the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to distribute the work.
PDM imposes no obligation for distribution.
PDM imposes no obligation to ensure exclusivity in fact, it's contrary to public domain.
PDM imposes no obligation to execute the work (if software).
PDM imposes no obligation to extract parts of the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to give the work to others.
PDM imposes no obligation to 'grant use'.
PDM imposes no obligation to include the work in other collections.
PDM imposes no obligation to index the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to inform others about the work (e.g. changes made), although if one indicates the work is PDM, they should not misrepresent it.
PDM imposes no obligation to install the work (if software).
PDM imposes no obligation to modify the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to move the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to adhere to a 'next policy'.
PDM imposes no obligation to provide a notice when using the work. The PDM itself is a notice about status.
PDM imposes no obligation to obtain consent for copyright purposes.
PDM imposes no obligation to play the work (if media).
PDM imposes no obligation to present the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to print the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to read the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to reproduce the work.
PDM imposes no obligation for reproduction.
PDM imposes no obligation to review any policy.
PDM imposes no obligation to sell the work.
PDM imposes no ShareAlike obligation.
PDM imposes no obligation for sharing.
PDM imposes no obligation to provide source code (this obligation is sometimes found in copyleft licenses for software).
PDM imposes no obligation to stream the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to synchronize media.
PDM imposes no obligation to convert text to speech.
PDM imposes no obligation to transform the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to translate the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to uninstall the work (if software).
PDM imposes no obligation to use the work.
PDM imposes no obligation to watermark the work.
